It is a small, mat-forming plant that thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in forested areas. Bromopsis pinetorum is characterized by its ability to tolerate low light conditions and is often found on soil or decaying wood. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature.
